modName: Eisa Blackthorn the Frostmere Crypt bandit - A Standalone Companion
summary: With a bounty for her dead or alive. Eisa Blackthorn flees to the Moorside Inn in Morthal. There she changes her appearance by removing her war paint and cutting her hair, to disguise who she really is. After her initial aggression towards the Dovahkiin, she will now happily follow him if asked.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static-5.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/4545067-1367359638.jpg[/img][/center]

Special Information

[color=yellow]This mod should not be activated until after visiting the Fostmere Crypt and completeing the Pale Lady quest. If there are two versions of Eisa Blackthorn in the Moorside Inn, pick the one that doesn't insult and/or attack you.[/color]

[color=yellow]Of course if you just want a cute follower she is waiting at the Moorside Inn in Morthal.[/color]

Discription

A former member of the White River Gang, Eisa Blackthorn led a mutiny that failed and was forced flee with her co-conspirator Ra'jirr.

Eventually, Eisa and Ra'jirr joined Kyr's band of looters in Frostmere Crypt, where she was put in charge of the dig. Eisa discovered an underground forest with a monument that held a strange sword, which Kyr immediately confiscated.

Soon afterwards, Ra'jirr began having visions about a Pale Lady and stole the sword from Kyr to return it to the forest.

Kyr assumed Eisa was involved as well and put a 100 gold bounty on her head, dead or alive.

Constantly being attacked by bounty hunters, Eisa Blackthorn fled to the Moorside Inn in Morthal. There she changed her appearance by removing her war paint and cutting her hair. After her initial aggression towards the Dovahkiin, she sees him as a method of escape and will follow him if asked.

Where to find her:

She resides in the Moorside Inn in Morthall.

Installation

[color=yellow][b]NMM strongly recommended.[/b][/color]

There are two versions regular and Nevernude, please choose just one.

This mod contains a number of loose files that need to be added to the meshes and texture folders. Missing one during manual installation will cause face and body problems.

Manual Installation

Extract this archive to any folder and then copy the contents to the Skyrim data
folder exactly as the archive shows. Be sure to enable the Eisa Blackthorn.esp

How to Uninstall

If installed with NMM use NMM and simply uninstall.

If manually installed delete:
meshesEisa Blackthorn and
meshesactorscharacterfacegendatafacegeomEisa Blackthorn.esp
texturesEisa Blackthorn and
texturescharacterfacegendatafacetintEisa Blackthorn.esp
Then delete the Eisa Blackthorn.esp in the data folder.

Incompatibility

None, if using a legal copy of Skyrim and updated to the latest version.

[color=red][b]Known Issues[/b][/color]

If you are limited in vram and running a lot of 2K texture mods, this mod may cause black face in some circumstances. Eisa Blackthorn uses a lot of HQ textures.

Used in screenshots:

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30936]RealVision ENB by SkyrimTuner[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30450]Realistic Lighting Overhaul by The Realistic Lighting Team[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17802]Project Reality - Climates Of Tamriel - Weather - Lighting - Audio by JJC71[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19733]Immersive Armors by hothtrooper44[/url]

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29411]TERA Armor Collection - CBBE - standalone by Frigus[/url]

Images

Feel free to post your images but remember no nudity or coarse language. Keep it clean and immersive.
